title: Wolf
data:

*For a list of all canines, see [list of canines](/List_of_canines "List of canines").*

|   | A strong wild canine, with sharp teeth and a healthy appetite.***“Teacher: How does a dog smell? Student: I don't know. Teacher: Correct!” -Traditional Spanish joke. |

## Useful Info

**Wolves** are very fast canines that travel in packs, slightly stronger than [hounds](/Hound "Hound") but generally not too threatening so long as you don't fight a lot of them at once. They can be found wild in [the Lair](/The_Lair "The Lair") and the [Ice Cave](/Ice_Cave "Ice Cave"), and appear elsewhere tamed by [Grum](/Grum "Grum").

## Tips & Tricks

- As with all pack monsters, try not to fight more wolves than you have to at a time. The Lair might not always have good choke points available, but you can generally at least get your back to a wall.
- Wolves are *extremely* fast -- faster than everything except [spriggans](/Spriggan "Spriggan"), and even then, a spriggan can only keep pace and can't actually outrun them. Even a [potion of haste](/Potion_of_haste "Potion of haste") isn't enough to allow a normal-speed character to outrun wolves on its own. If you absolutely have to escape, either combine haste and [Swiftness](/Swiftness "Swiftness"), blink to a stairway, or just read a [scroll of teleportation](/Scroll_of_teleportation "Scroll of teleportation").
- Be careful when fighting them off in a [spriggan druid](/Spriggan_druid "Spriggan druid")'s forest. Slugging it out with a pack of wolves becomes *much* more dangerous when someone casts [Awaken Forest](/Awaken_Forest "Awaken Forest") in the middle of the fight.

## History

- Prior to [0.31](/0.31 "0.31"), players could summon them via [Call Canine Familiar](/Call_Canine_Familiar "Call Canine Familiar").
- [War dogs](/War_dog "War dog") were removed in [0.13](/0.13 "0.13"), and wolves' stats were bumped up to compensate. Grum's pack of war dogs became a pack of wolves in that version.
html:
Wolf

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.31: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.

For a list of all canines, see list of canines.

wolf h 
HP 14-30
HD 4
XP 116
Speed 17
AC 4
EV 15
Will 20
Attack1 12 (bite: plain)


Resistances None
Vulnerabilities None
Habitat Land
Intelligence Animal
Uses Uses nothing
Holiness Natural
Size Medium
Type hound, wolf
Flags See invisible
Unblindable
Warm-blooded
A strong wild canine, with sharp teeth and a healthy appetite.

“Teacher: How does a dog smell?
Student: I don't know.
Teacher: Correct!”
-Traditional Spanish joke.

Useful Info

Wolves are very fast canines that travel in packs, slightly stronger than hounds but generally not too threatening so long as you don't fight a lot of them at once. They can be found wild in the Lair and the Ice Cave, and appear elsewhere tamed by Grum.

Tips & Tricks

  • As with all pack monsters, try not to fight more wolves than you have to at a time. The Lair might not always have good choke points available, but you can generally at least get your back to a wall.
  • Wolves are extremely fast -- faster than everything except spriggans, and even then, a spriggan can only keep pace and can't actually outrun them. Even a potion of haste isn't enough to allow a normal-speed character to outrun wolves on its own. If you absolutely have to escape, either combine haste and Swiftness, blink to a stairway, or just read a scroll of teleportation.
  • Be careful when fighting them off in a spriggan druid's forest. Slugging it out with a pack of wolves becomes much more dangerous when someone casts Awaken Forest in the middle of the fight.

History

  • Prior to 0.31, players could summon them via Call Canine Familiar.
  • War dogs were removed in 0.13, and wolves' stats were bumped up to compensate. Grum's pack of war dogs became a pack of wolves in that version.

==Useful Info==
'''Wolves''' are very fast canines that travel in packs, slightly stronger than [[hound]]s but generally not too threatening so long as you don't fight a lot of them at once. They can be found wild in [[the Lair]] and the [[Ice Cave]], and appear elsewhere tamed by [[Grum]].

==Tips & Tricks==
*As with all pack monsters, try not to fight more wolves than you have to at a time. The Lair might not always have good choke points available, but you can generally at least get your back to a wall.
*Wolves are ''extremely'' fast -- faster than everything except [[spriggan]]s, and even then, a spriggan can only keep pace and can't actually outrun them. Even a [[potion of haste]] isn't enough to allow a normal-speed character to outrun wolves on its own. If you absolutely have to escape, either combine haste and [[Swiftness]], blink to a stairway, or just read a [[scroll of teleportation]].
*Be careful when fighting them off in a [[spriggan druid]]'s forest. Slugging it out with a pack of wolves becomes ''much'' more dangerous when someone casts [[Awaken Forest]] in the middle of the fight.

==History==
*Prior to [[0.31]], players could summon them via [[Call Canine Familiar]].
*[[War dog]]s were removed in [[0.13]], and wolves' stats were bumped up to compensate. Grum's pack of war dogs became a pack of wolves in that version.
